Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can observe and accurately draw a specific habitat from their surroundings or media sources, including detailed elements of the environment such as terrain, bodies of water, and sky.
The student can include in their drawing a diverse array of plants found in the selected habitat, realistically depicting trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants with accurate colors and shapes.
The student can include various types of animals found in the habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, birds, and insects, showing them engaging in typical behaviors appropriate to their environment.
The student can effectively demonstrate comparisons between different habitats by accurately showing differences (e.g., land vs. water ecosystems) and the types of living things present in each.

The student can use their drawing to identify and explain patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats, indicating an understanding of why certain species thrive in specific environments.

The student can organize their drawing logically and clearly, using labels effectively to indicate specific species, features of the habitat, and to highlight observed patterns or interactions among living things.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details in the labeling of the drawing, such as not labeling a small plant or animal though it's drawn correctly (student overlooks small labeling details).
The student might inaccurately draw or label an obscure species if it is not well-known or typically observed in classroom settings (student may misinterpret lesser-known species features).
